info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:51PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pierce, southwestern Wayne and southeastern Appling Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 251 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Screven, or 9 miles southwest of Jesup. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Patterson, Screven, Offerman and Bristol. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
